channel.title: NPC changes to another NPC, and Making an object view thats in the wall
channel.description: Hello, I am Arham 4, and I'm back Now that I'm back, I would like to ask something. How do you make an NPC change to another NPC. Also, How do I make an object be viewable that's on the wall. For example, I click Glourphe's Notes, you click it, and you see the notes thats written. When I do that, how will I add anything to the notes. If this is not possible, how can I edit the text in the Securaty Book and How do I change the look of the book? Thanks, Arham

item.title: NPC changes to another NPC, and Making an object view thats in the wall
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

smokin flax:

Gahahhaah alot of that is client sided, for example clicking the notes, is client sided, as well as editing the text in the security book/look of the book (maybe text in the book, might also be server sided) What base? Npc change to another NPC? That would require adding a new void setting a npc.updateRequried boolean. Not too terribly difficult…

Sorry, forgot to give the base. Well, I am doing this just for my school :p, so it’s delta.

Read full topic
item.source: NPC changes to another NPC, and Making an object view thats in the wall

item.title: NPC changes to another NPC, and Making an object view thats in the wall

item.description:
@imsuperman05 wrote:

Use sendFrame126, but you have to find the ID’s.

item.title: NPC changes to another NPC, and Making an object view thats in the wall
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Hello, I am Arham 4, and I’m back
Now that I’m back, I would like to ask something. How do you make an NPC change to another NPC. Also, How do I make an object be viewable that’s on the wall. For example, I click Glourphe’s Notes, you click it, and you see the notes thats written. When I do that, how will I add anything to the notes. If this is not possible, how can I edit the text in the Securaty Book and How do I change the look of the book?
Thanks,
Arham
